articles.author: ZEKE MILLER and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden is set to use his State of the Union address Thursday to promote his vision for a second term to a dispirited electorate who questions whether he's up to the job and to warn that GOP front-runner Donald Trump would be a dangerous alternative.
articles.title: Biden is hoping to use his State of the Union address to show a wary electorate he's up to the job

articles.author: BILL BARROW and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Joe Biden and Donald Trump each won the White House by razor-thin margins in key states.
articles.title: The Biden and Trump campaigns are readying for their rematch, starting with rival events in Georgia

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Egyptian officials said Thursday that negotiations over a cease-fire in Gaza are at an impasse as Hamas insists on a process to end to the war. After nearly five months of war, much of Gaza is in ruins, and international pressure is growing for Israel and Hamas to reach a deal that would halt the fighting and release the remaining Israeli hostages held by Hamas.
articles.title: The Latest | Gaza cease-fire talks are at an impasse, Egyptian officials say

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The first fatal attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels on shipping threatens to further sever a crucial maritime artery for global trade and carries with it risks beyond those just at sea.
articles.title: Analysis: First fatal attack on shipping by Yemen's Houthi rebels escalates risk for reeling Mideast

articles.author: KIM CHANDLER
articles.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Facing pressure to get in vitro fertilization services restarted in the state, Alabama's governor swiftly signed legislation into law Wednesday shielding doctors from potential legal liability raised by a court ruling that equated frozen embryos to children.
articles.title: Alabama governor signs legislation protecting IVF providers from legal liability into law

articles.author: DASHA LITVINOVA
articles.description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — It's not just opposition politicians who are targeted in the crackdown by Russian President Vladimir Putin's government in recent years.
articles.title: Putin's crackdown casts a wide net, ensnaring the LGBTQ+ community, lawyers and many others

articles.author: AYSE WIETING and SUZAN FRASER
articles.description: ISTANBUL (AP) — Muhterem Evcil was stabbed to death by her estranged husband at her workplace in Istanbul, where he had repeatedly harassed her in breach of a restraining order. The day before, authorities detained him for violating the order but let him go free after questioning.
articles.title: Turkey struggles to stop violence against women. At least 71 have been killed this year

articles.author: EILEEN NG
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — Over the past decade, Grace Subathirai Nathan graduated from law school, got married, opened a law firm and had two babies. But part of her is frozen in time, still in denial over the loss of her mother on a missing Malaysia Airlines plane in 2014.
articles.title: Frozen in time: Families of those on missing Flight 370 cannot shake off their grief without answers

articles.author: JAMIE STENGLE
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — Once again, most Americans will set their clocks forward by one hour this weekend, losing perhaps a bit of sleep but gaining more glorious sunlight in the evenings as the days warm into summer.
articles.title: Why are clocks set forward in the spring? Thank wars, confusion and a hunger for sunlight

articles.author: DEEPTI HAJELA and WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Once upon a time, there was a brief outage on some social media platforms. It got fixed. The end. On the face of it, kind of a boring story.But the widespread attention given to the blanking of Meta’s Facebook, Instagram, Threads and Messenger platforms on Tuesday suggests another, perhaps less obvious tale: the one that shows that social media platforms, like the books or newspapers or insert-medium-here of other times in history, matter more than just being entertaining pastimes.
articles.title: For social platforms, the outage was short. But people's stories vanished, and that's no small thing
